entry.title: Welbore Ellis Agar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an auction of the art collection of Welbore Ellis Agar was abandoned when all of it, including works by Velazquez, Poussin, Lorrain, Murillo, and Rubens (example pictured) was bought by Earl Grosvenor?

entry.title: Naikilah Perusahaan Minang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Naikilah Perusahaan Minang is the oldest operating autobus company in Indonesia?

entry.title: Dave Wasserman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an article by Dave Wasserman two months before the 2016 U.S. presidential election correctly predicted that Donald Trump would win despite losing the popular vote?

entry.title: CLODO (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that CLODO's initialism is also a French slang term for 'bum' or 'homeless'?

entry.title: Joseph Longworth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while Joseph Longworth thought that he would be remembered only as "the son of his father and the father of his son", there is today a wing of the Cincinnati Art Museum named for him?

entry.title: Umma–Lagash (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Professor of History Lorenzo Kamel deems Umma–Lagash the first recorded war in human history?

entry.title: Furlong Flynn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after playing professional football, Furlong Flynn became an aviation pioneer?

entry.title: Frabjoy & the Runcible Spoon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before Godley & Creme were one half of 10cc, they were Frabjoy & the Runcible Spoon?
